instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used to classify different types of dark septate endophytes (DSEs) fungi and detect their growth stages in a non-destructive and time-saving manner?
Output: The related study used nir spectral data to classify different types of dark septate endophytes (DSEs) fungi and detect their growth stages in a non-destructive and time-saving manner.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used to classify different types of dark septate endophytes (DSEs) fungi and detect their growth stages in a non-destructive and time-saving manner?
Output: Block scaling (BS), De-trending (DET), first (FST) and second (SED) derivatives were used as spectral feature processing methods to classify different types of dark septate endophytes (DSEs) fungi and detect their growth stages in a non-destructive and time-saving manner.

instruction: What metric was chosen to classify different types of dark septate endophytes (DSEs) fungi and detect their growth stages in a non-destructive and time-saving manner?
Output: The metric chosen to classify different types of dark septate endophytes (DSEs) fungi and detect their growth stages in a non-destructive and time-saving manner was the mean accuracy.

instruction: What machine learning model was used in the related study on using SWIR spectroscopy to classify different types of dark septate endophytes (DSEs) fungi and detect their growth stages in a non-destructive and time-saving manner?
Output: The machine learning model used in the related study to classify different types of dark septate endophytes (DSEs) fungi and detect their growth stages in a non-destructive and time-saving manner was the support vector machine (SVM) model.

instruction: Can the combination of DET_FST processing spectra and SVM model be considered a superior method compared to traditional methods for classifying different types of dark septate endophytes (DSEs) fungi and detecting their growth stages in a non-destructive and time-saving manner, as demonstrated in the related study?
Output: Yes, the combination of DET_FST processing spectra and SVM model can be considered a superior method compared to traditional methods for classifying different types of dark septate endophytes (DSEs) fungi and detecting their growth stages in a non-destructive and time-saving manner, as demonstrated in the related study on using SWIR spectroscopy. The related study showed that this combination yielded the best classification accuracy for fungi classification at different growth stages and growth stage detection on different fungus types. The mean accuracy of the generic model for fungi classification and growth stage detection were 0.92 and 0.99 on the calibration set, respectively. This method provides a rapid and efficient tool for studying fungi and can be used for classification and growth stage detection in a non-destructive and time-saving manner.
